intro: Paracarphalea kirondron subsp. kirondron, commonly known as the Kirondron paracarphalea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands or disturbed soils. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to arid environments, with efficient water conservation mechanisms.
